meanings.definition: Having a slightly yellowish or pale complexion.
meanings.sent1: Her sallowish skin made her look a bit sickly.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the old house were painted in a sallowish hue.
meanings.sent3: The sallowish light of the streetlamp gave the alley a spooky feel.
meanings.sent4: The sallowish moon cast an eerie glow over the deserted town.
meanings.sent5: The sallowish color of the leaves hinted at the arrival of autumn.

meanings.definition: Somewhat resembling the color of sallow skin.
meanings.sent1: The artist mixed paints to achieve a sallowish shade for the portrait.
meanings.sent2: The sallowish curtains in the room added a touch of warmth.
meanings.sent3: The sallowish tone of the painting gave it a unique charm.
meanings.sent4: The sallowish glow of the fire lit up the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The sallowish tint of the sky signaled the approaching storm.
